replies.body: I don't see Morde ever beating Riven unless she's terrible

How so?
Every Mordekaiser main knows Riven is by far Morde's easiest matchup.
She plays directly into Mordekaiser's hands as he wants the enemy to go in on him and her bad base stats make him able to completely destroy her.

Level 1-2 are the only tricky levels as he should avoid getting cheesed-

First time I played Morde in a norm was counterpicking him against Riven. Lost that game, but it certainly wasn't because of top. Riven was not having a good time. She couldn't farm, she couldn't fight, she could scarcely do anything. It's just so astoundingly easy of a matchup even for a very inexperienced Morde.

It also helps that literally every item you buy against her makes her life that much more terrible. Rylai's removes a bit of her mobility, nashor's (a go to item I think I may have read MM suggesting was good on him) makes it so that she will take constant damage in lane, liandrys adds decent survivability against her, and worst case scenario you can go zhonyas and ignore half of her burst anyways. Super simple matchup with an even easier way to understand it: Mordy kills most divers.
Make rylais great again

> Did Hexdrinker and Death's Dance stop existing?

Morde isn't all AP, you know. He can build hybrid. When someone builds MR rush, I just build AD and magic pen. Ez.

As for Deaths Dance, Gunblade gives morde sustain, and AD just makes Morde's Q bursty and his E pretty strong.
If Morde builds Hybrid beyond a gunblade and MAYBE a triforce, MAYBE, he already lost. AD scales super poorly on Mordekaiser beyond level 5.
Levels 1-2 are Morde's best levels against her because he has just as much cheese potential against her.
rivens lvl 2 combo is much much better than morde, and can result in an early first blood if you're unprepared for it, whereas riven can just q away if she starts losing the trade
You can outtrade her level 2 if she dashes into your w, which they often do, so it is winnable.

Riven's level 2 requires her to q in or not get in range. Riven walks within her Q range? You walk back. She Q's in? You hit her. She dashes away immediately? So what? She just used two abilities to deal one Q of damage to you, while you can auto-reset q. She all-ins? She missed her first q (to get to you) and needs w to straight-up kill you. If she took w second, you have many more options to face her via positioning and minion tactics (getting one of your minions behind her, for example). 

Beyond that, her one-rotation power is actually enough to kill him 100-0 even if she uses one or two Qs to gapclose; she can't do this at level 2 if Morde did anything right. Morde, however, actually DOES have enough to 100-0 her at level 2.

But Riven is considered his worst matchup on op.gg
https://na.op.gg/champion/mordekaiser/statistics/top

This is completely false. She has too much mobility to stick to and after she gets executioners it's a huge issue. It's a skill matchup in her favor right after level 6. Not even close to his easiest matchup unless the Riven is horrible.

Too much mobility to stick to? I think you fail to understand what Mordekaiser does.

If Riven wants to get a kill, she has to go in on him. He has a heal that applies to enemies near him, a Q that increases his basic attack's damage three times, and an E that gives him %shield for hitting a champion, plus it has some range so it can be used while she's going in on him.

Morde gets a shield for hurting an enemy champion with his spells. Riven has to be within his range to hurt him.

Riven quite literally has to play into the strengths of Morde's kit. I don't see how that can be advantageous for anyone to do when Morde is a Juggernaut.

No, I don't think you do. I don't know about you, but I've faced some of the best Riven's NA. I know what someone using Riven to her full potential can do, and I know the inside and outs of the matchup cause I've faced it at least 100+ times. Fact is, it's a matchup you win early, and then slightly lose after 6. Morde just can't handle Riven in a 1 v 1 situation after she's poked him down a bit or got a hexdrinker, regardless of your own build. 

She has a shield to block your E damage, in every circumstance. CC to lock you down then dash away before you can get any of your damage off. And has an easy way to build executioners calling based on how her kit works in general. After she gets her hexdrinker, and is working on an executioners, you WILL lose that lane, and if she is farming properly this should be around level 6 to level 8. 

I've played almost 400 games of mordeakiser this season with a 57% winrate in mid Diamond 3 currently. I'm going to understand the champion better than you do.
